alert.note: Alert for Bexar (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 20 at 4:29AM CDT until May 20 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following county, Bexar. * WHEN...Until 615 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 427 AM CDT, Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Emergency management reported flooding occurring at several low water crossings across western San Antonio and Bexar County. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Antonio, Leon Valley, Alamo Heights, Terrell Hills, Olmos Park, Lackland AFB, Sea World and Balcones Heights. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
